title: IndexError in Python
text: Always check list length before accessing by index.

title: NullReference in Java
text: Ensure the object is not null before calling its method.

title: Division by Zero
text: Add guard condition before dividing numbers.

title: TypeError in Python
text: Cast or convert values to the expected type before operations.

title: KeyError in Python dict
text: Use dict.get(key, default) or check key in dict before access.

title: AttributeError in Python
text: Verify object initialization and attribute names; use hasattr when needed.

title: FileNotFoundError
text: Check file path/existence; create directories or handle missing files.

title: JSON decode error
text: Validate input is valid JSON; wrap json.loads in try/except.

title: Memory leak in Java
text: Close streams and release references; use try-with-resources.

title: Deadlock in Java
text: Lock in consistent order or use higher-level concurrency primitives.

title: Race condition (threads)
text: Protect shared state with mutex/lock or use atomic structures.

title: SQL injection risk
text: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements; never string-concatenate SQL.

title: Off-by-one in loops
text: Review loop bounds; prefer < length rather than <= length.

title: Floating point precision
text: Avoid equality comparisons; compare within a small epsilon tolerance.

title: Time zone bug
text: Store times in UTC; convert to local zones only at the edges.

title: Path separator portability
text: Use OS path utilities (Path/Pathlib) instead of hardcoded separators.

title: C++ dangling pointer
text: Use smart pointers (unique_ptr/shared_ptr) and RAII to manage lifetime.

title: C++ uninitialized variable
text: Always initialize variables; enable compiler warnings for uninitialized use.

title: C++ out-of-bounds vector
text: Use at() with checks or validate index before access.

title: JavaScript undefined access
text: Check obj && obj.prop; use optional chaining (obj?.prop) where supported.

title: JavaScript promise not awaited
text: Return or await the Promise to ensure proper sequencing and error handling.

title: C# null reference
text: Use null-conditional operator (?.) or guard clauses before use.

title: C# LINQ deferred exec trap
text: Materialize with ToList() when multiple enumerations cause issues.

title: PHP notice: undefined index
text: Use isset/array_key_exists before array access or provide defaults.

title: PHP SQL injection
text: Use PDO prepared statements with bound parameters.

title: Go nil pointer dereference
text: Check for nil before method calls; return error + nil pattern.

title: Go goroutine leak
text: Ensure goroutines exit via context cancellation or channel close.

title: Rust borrow checker error
text: Reduce simultaneous mutable/immutable borrows; clone when ownership needed.

title: Rust panic on unwrap
text: Handle Result/Option with match or ?; avoid unwrap in production.

title: Regex catastrophic backtracking
text: Use non-greedy qualifiers or atomic groups; simplify the pattern.

title: HTTP timeout
text: Set client timeouts and retry policy; avoid infinite waits.

title: API rate limit
text: Implement exponential backoff and respect Retry-After headers.

title: Caching stale data
text: Include cache invalidation strategy or ETag/Last-Modified checks.

title: Cross-site scripting (XSS)
text: HTML-encode user output; use templating that escapes by default.

title: CORS blocked request
text: Configure server CORS headers (Access-Control-Allow-Origin, methods).

title: Unicode encoding error
text: Open files with correct encoding (UTF-8) and handle decode errors.

title: Logging sensitive data
text: Mask or omit secrets/tokens; centralize logging sanitization.

title: I/O resource leak
text: Always close files/sockets; use context managers or try-with-resources.

title: Thread-unsafe collection
text: Use concurrent collections or synchronize access.

title: Python recursion limit
text: Convert deep recursion to iterative approach or increase sys.setrecursionlimit cautiously.

title: Numpy broadcasting mismatch
text: Ensure shapes align; expand dims or reshape prior to vectorized ops.

title: Pandas SettingWithCopy
text: Use .loc explicit assignment; avoid chained indexing.

title: Matplotlib blocking show
text: Use non-interactive backends or plt.close() in batch scripts.

title: GPU OOM in ML
text: Reduce batch size/sequence length; use gradient accumulation or mixed precision.

title: Model not deterministic
text: Set random seeds and disable nondeterministic kernels where possible.

title: Java concurrent modification
text: Iterate with iterator.remove or collect to new list before removal.

title: C++ integer overflow
text: Use wider types or check bounds before arithmetic.

title: JavaScript floating math bug
text: Use integer math or libraries (Decimal.js) for money/precision.

title: Slow SQL query
text: Add proper indexes, avoid SELECT *, and analyze execution plans.

title: Duplicate primary key
text: Use unique constraints and handle conflicts with UPSERT/ON CONFLICT.

title: CSV parsing error
text: Specify delimiter/quote/escape options; handle header presence.

title: Timezone naive datetime
text: Use timezone-aware objects; normalize to UTC internally.

title: JWT expired
text: Check exp and refresh token; implement clock skew tolerance.

title: Password stored in plain text
text: Hash with bcrypt/argon2 and use per-user salts.

title: Unsafe eval/exec
text: Remove dynamic eval; use safe interpreters or whitelists.

title: Filesystem race (TOCTOU)
text: Open with O_EXCL or perform checks and open atomically.

title: Resource starvation with retry
text: Add jitter/backoff and circuit breaker to avoid overload.

title: Docker container timezone
text: Set TZ env or use UTC; mount /etc/localtime when required.

title: Kubernetes liveness flapping
text: Tune probe thresholds/initialDelaySeconds and readiness checks.

title: UTF-8 BOM surprises
text: Strip BOM or open files with encoding='utf-8-sig'.

title: Python: Off-by-one list access
text: Python lists use 0-based indexing. For a list of size N, the valid indices are 0 to N-1. Accessing index N causes an `IndexError`. Fix: Use `len(list) - 1` for the last element or iterate using `range(len(list))` and check bounds.

title: Java: Null check necessity
text: Java methods on object references will throw a `NullPointerException` if the object is `null`. Always check if an object is `null` before calling any method on it, or use Java 8's `Optional` for safer handling.

title: C++: Vector out-of-bounds
text: Accessing a C++ `std::vector` element beyond its size using the `[]` operator results in undefined behavior (a common source of crashes). Use `vector.at(index)` to get automatic bounds checking and throw a `std::out_of_range` exception.

title: Python: Safe attribute access
text: To prevent `AttributeError` when a variable might be `None` (a common `NoneType` bug), use an explicit check: `if obj is not None:`. If cleaning user input, ensure it's not `None` before calling `.strip()` or similar methods.

title: Guarding Division by Zero
text: In most languages (Python, Java, C++), dividing an integer by zero causes an exception (e.g., `ZeroDivisionError`, `ArithmeticException`). Always add an `if` condition to check if the divisor is zero before performing the operation.

title: Python: File Resource Leak
text: Python objects that manage external resources, like file handles, must be explicitly closed using `.close()` or, preferably, the `with open(...)` context manager to ensure release even if exceptions occur.

title: Python: Context Manager for Files
text: Use the `with open(...) as f:` syntax for file operations. This structure automatically handles resource closure, preventing file resource leaks and ensuring clean code.

title: Java: Concurrency Race Condition
text: When a shared variable (like a counter) is modified by multiple threads, the operation must be atomic. Use the `synchronized` keyword on the method, or use atomic classes like `AtomicInteger` to protect the shared state.

title: Java: Atomic Operations
text: Classes in `java.util.concurrent.atomic` provide atomic operations (e.g., `incrementAndGet`) for single variables, ensuring thread safety and preventing race conditions without requiring extensive locking.

title: C++: Memory Allocation and Deallocation
text: Every use of `new` for a single object requires a corresponding `delete`. Every use of `new[]` for an array requires a corresponding `delete[]`. Failing to deallocate leads to memory leaks, degrading application performance.

title: C++: Smart Pointers
text: In modern C++, prefer smart pointers like `std::unique_ptr` or `std::shared_ptr` over raw pointers. Smart pointers automatically manage memory deallocation via RAII (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization), effectively eliminating most manual memory leaks.

title: SQL Injection Prevention
text: Never build SQL queries by string concatenation, especially with unvalidated user input. Use **parameterized queries** or **prepared statements** provided by your database driver to separate the SQL code from the user data.

title: Python: Safe SQL Queries
text: Use placeholder syntax (`%s` for old style, or `?` or named placeholders) with your database connector's `cursor.execute()` method to pass user input as data, preventing SQL injection attacks.

title: Logic: Infinite Loops
text: An infinite loop occurs when the loop's termination condition is never met. Ensure that the loop counter or the state variable used in the `while` or `for` condition is modified correctly (e.g., incremented or decremented) within the loop body.

title: Python: Fixing Infinite Loops
text: In a `while` loop that iterates over a list index, ensure the index variable (`i` in your case) is incremented on every iteration using `i += 1` to prevent the condition from remaining perpetually true, thus avoiding an infinite loop.
